category: Sports Fair Committee Regulations/Article 11 (Exclusion, Avoidance, Avoidance)
contents: Article 11 (Exclusion, Avoidance, Refusal) ① The chairperson, vice-chairperson, and members shall not be involved in the deliberation and resolution of the committee in the following cases. 1. If the subject of deliberation is a relative (referring to a relative under Article 777 of the Civil Act) 2. If there is a relationship with the relevant deliberation matter 3. If there is a direct interest in the member himself or herself 4. In other cases where fairness cannot be maintained When there is a valid reason ② If there is a reasonable reason to believe that there is a risk of unfair decision-making among the chairperson, vice-chairman, and members, the person subject to deliberation may disclose the fact in writing and apply for recusal. ③ If it falls under paragraph (1), the chairperson, vice-chairman or member must voluntarily avoid deliberation and resolution of the relevant deliberation case, and may avoid deliberation and resolution if it falls under paragraph (2). ④ When a request for challenge is filed pursuant to paragraph 2, the decision on whether to challenge shall be made upon the attendance of a majority of the registered members and the resolution of a majority of the members present. In this case, the member who received the request for recusal cannot participate in the decision.
